sen.j: 河野 玉澄（こうの たますみ）は7世紀ごろの武将。
sen.e: Tamasumi KONO was a Japanese military commander around the 7th century.
Tamasumi KONO was a Japanese military commander around the 7th century.
Tamasumi KONO was a Japanese military commander around the 7th century.

sen.j: 663年に起こった白村江の戦いの時、伊予水軍を率いて出陣した越智（おち）守興と、戦地の中国娘との間に生まれた子が玉澄（たますみ）とされている。
sen.e: It is said that Tamasumi was a child of Morioki OCHI, who went to the Battle of Hakusukinoe leading the Iyo navy, and a Chinese girl in the battlefield.
It is said that Tamasumi was a child born between Morioki OCHI, who went to the Battle of Hakusukinoe leading the Iyo navy, and a Chinese girl he met during the war.
sen.cmt: a Chinese girl in the battlefieldでは、戦場にいた(戦いに関わっていた)中国娘という感じがするので、戦時中に出会った中国娘という意味で訳し直しました。
sen.e: It is said that Tamasumi was a child born between Morioki OCHI, who went to the Battle of Hakusukinoe leading the Iyo navy, and a Chinese girl he met during the war.

sen.j: その後、伊予国風早郡河野郷（現在の愛媛県松山市）に居を構えたことから河野玉澄（こうのたますみ）と名乗り、河野（こうの）を名乗った初代とされている。
sen.e: Living in Kono-go, Kazahaya District, Iyo Province (now Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture), he called himself Tamasumi KONO as the founder of the Kono family.
Living in Kono-go, Kazahaya District, Iyo Province (modern Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture), he called himself Tamasumi KONO and he was first to use the name of KONO.
sen.cmt: 「現在の」は自身の担当した翻訳の中ではnowではなく modernと訳したためそれにならいました。また「名乗った初代」に関しては、翻訳では河野家の創始者として訳されているが、原文に忠実に河野の名前を使った初めての人、と訳しなおしました。
sen.e: Living in Kono-go, Kazahaya District, Iyo Province (modern Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture), he called himself Tamasumi KONO and he was first to use the name of KONO.

sen.j: また本人のものと伝承されている墓は愛媛県今治市の小泉にある。
sen.e: In addition, the tomb which is said to be his is in Koizumi, Imabari City, Ehime Prefecture.
The tomb which is said to be his is in Koizumi, Imabari City, Ehime Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文の「また」は話題を切り替えるためのもので特に重要な意味はありません。
sen.e: The tomb which is said to be his is in Koizumi, Imabari City, Ehime Prefecture.
